swp_compiler_ss13.fuc.backend

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • swp_compiler_ss13.fuc.backend.Module

  • public class Module
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows for the generation of an LLVM IR module. Each methode that begins with "add" generates LLVM IR code and writes it to the PrintWriter out.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ArrayType> arNamespace 
      private java.io.PrintWriter out
      The PrintWriter which the generated LLVM IR is written with.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> stringLiterals
      A list of all the string literals that exist in this module where each element describes a string literal's number with its position in the list and that string literal's length with the value of the element.
      private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> variableIsReference 
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> variableUseCount
      This maps a variable's name (not its identifier, which is %{name}) to the number of times it has been used in the module already.

    • Field Detail

      • stringLiterals

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> stringLiterals
        A list of all the string literals that exist in this module where each element describes a string literal's number with its position in the list and that string literal's length with the value of the element.

      • variableUseCount

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> variableUseCount
        This maps a variable's name (not its identifier, which is %{name}) to the number of times it has been used in the module already. This is necessary because LLVM's IR allows only for static single assignment (SSA), wich means we have to store the variable's actual value as the destination of a static pointer and generate a new 'use' variable (%{name}.{use_number}) for every time the variable is read from or written to and route the pointer access through that use variable.

      • variableIsReference

        private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> variableIsReference

      • out

        private java.io.PrintWriter out
        The PrintWriter which the generated LLVM IR is written with.

      • arNamespace

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ArrayType> arNamespace

      • getIRAType

        private java.lang.String getIRAType(Type.Kind type,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> dimensions)
        Get the LLVM IR type corresponding to an *array* type from the three address code.
        Parameters:
        type - the final type of the array, eg: double[][] --> double
        sizes - a list of sizes of the array dimensions, eg: double x[5][10][7] --> [5,10,7]
        Returns:
        the corresponding LLVM IR type for the array

                      java.lang.String src)

        dst - the destination variable's name
        src - the source constant or the source variable's name

        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • cdl

        private java.lang.String cdl(java.lang.String constantOrIdentifier,
                   Type.Kind type)
                      throws BackendException
        Conditionally loads a constant or an identifier. If given a constant, just the leading # character is removed. If given a variable (anything without leading # character), it is being loaded and the temporary register name is returned.
        Parameters:
        constantOrIdentifier - Name of a constant or identifier.
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • addPrimitiveConversion

        public void addPrimitiveConversion(Type.Kind srcType,
                          java.lang.String src,
                          Type.Kind dstType,
                          java.lang.String dst)
                            throws BackendException
        Assigns the value of one variable (src) to another variable (dst), where their types must only be convertible, not identical.
        Parameters:

        src - the source variable's name
        dstType - the destination variable's type

        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveBinaryInstruction

        public void addPrimitiveBinaryInstruction(Quadruple.Operator op,
                                 Type.Kind resultType,
                                 Type.Kind argumentType,
                                 java.lang.String lhs,
                                 java.lang.String rhs,
                                 java.lang.String dst)
                                   throws BackendException
        Adds a generic binary operation of two sources - each can either be a constant or a variable - the result of which will be stored in a variable (dst). All types must be identical.
        Parameters:
        op - the binary operation to add
        resultType - the result type of the binary operation
        argumentType - the argument type of the binary operation
        lhs - the constant or name of the variable on the left hand side
        rhs - the constant or name of the variable on the right hand side
        dst - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveBinaryCall

        public void addPrimitiveBinaryCall(Quadruple.Operator op,
                          Type.Kind resultType,
                          Type.Kind argumentType,
                          java.lang.String lhs,
                          java.lang.String rhs,
                          java.lang.String dst)
                            throws BackendException
        Adds a call to a argument-homogenous binary functions where each argument can either be a constant or a variable; the result of the function will be stored in a variable (dst). Argument types must both be equal, but may differ from the result type.
        Parameters:
        op - the binary operation to add
        resultType - the type of the binary operation's result
        argumentType - the type of the binary operation's arguments
        lhs - the constant or name of the variable on the left hand side
        rhs - the constant or name of the variable on the right hand side
        dst - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addBooleanNot

        public void addBooleanNot(java.lang.String source,
                 java.lang.String destination)
                   throws BackendException
        Adds a binary not operation, where the source may be either a constant, or a variable, whereas the result must be a variable.
        Parameters:
        source - the constant or name of the variable to be negated
        destination - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addMainReturn

        public void addMainReturn(java.lang.String value)
                   throws BackendException
        Adds the return instruction for the main method.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to return (exit code)
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addLabel

        public void addLabel(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a label which may be the target of branching instructions.
        Parameters:
        name - the label's name, must be unique in the program

      • addBranch

        public void addBranch(java.lang.String target1,
             java.lang.String target2,
             java.lang.String condition)
               throws BackendException
        Adds a branching instruction, which may either be unconditional (e.g. branch immediately) or depend on a boolean variable 'condition' (e.g. branch to one of two target labels depening on the boolean variable's value at runtime).
        Parameters:
        target1 - target label for unconditional branch, target for the condition being true for conditional branch
        target2 - Quadruple.EmptyArgument for unconditional branch, target for the condition being false for the conditional branch
        condition - Quadruple.EmptyArgument for unconditional branch, the condition being tested for conditional branch
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrint

        public void addPrint(java.lang.String value,
            Type.Kind type)
              throws BackendException
        Adds a call to the printf function for the value, which may be either a constant or the name of a variable.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be printed
        type - the type of the value (boolean, long, double, string)
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs
